message_1: Suppose we want to encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using Playfair cipher. Using the keyword "CRYPTO", what is the resulting ciphertext?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using the Playfair cipher with the keyword "CRYPTO", we first need to create the 5x5 Playfair matrix using the keyword.

1. Remove duplicate letters from the keyword: "CRYPTO" -> "CRYPTO"
2. Fill in the remaining alphabet letters (excluding J) in the matrix after the keyword: "CRYPTOABDFGHIKLMNQSUVWXZ"
3. Create the 5x5 matrix:

C R Y P T
O A B D F
G H I K L
M N Q S U
V W X Z

4. Split the message into digraphs (adding an X if needed to make it even length): "MA TH EM AT IC SX"
5. Encrypt each digraph using the matrix:

MA -> OQ
TH -> YD
EM -> CR
AT -> FD
IC -> KL
SX -> UV

6. Combine the encrypted digraphs to get the ciphertext: "OQYDCRFDKLUV"

So, the resulting ciphertext is "OQYDCRFDKLUV".
